009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fd;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013import static java.lang.Math.PI;
014import static java.lang.Math.cos;
015import static java.lang.Math.sin;
016import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Complex;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * Defines static methods to create Fourier descriptors directly from 2D
025 * polygons without re-sampling or interpolation. See Ch. 26 of [1] for
026 * additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
030 * Algorithmic Introduction Using Java</em>, 2nd ed, Springer (2016).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2022/10/24
035 */
036public abstract class FourierDescriptorTrigonometric {
037        
038        private FourierDescriptorTrigonometric() {}
039        
040        /**
041         * Creates a {@link FourierDescriptor} directly from
042         * the vertices of a closed polygon (without interpolation).
043         * For a given number (mp) of Fourier coefficient pairs,
044         * the resulting number of Fourier coefficients is M = 2 * mp + 1.
045         * 
046         * @param V sequence of 2D points representing a closed polygon
047         * @param mp the number of Fourier coefficient pairs (arbitrary)
048         * @return a new {@link FourierDescriptorTrigonometric} instance
049         */
050        public static FourierDescriptor from(Pnt2d[] V, int mp) {
051                Complex[] G = makeDftSpectrumTrigonometric(FourierDescriptor.toComplexArray(V), mp);
052                return new FourierDescriptor(G);
053        }
054
055        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
056        
057        private static Complex[] makeDftSpectrumTrigonometric(Complex[] g, int mp) {
058                final int N = g.length;                         // number of polygon vertices
059                final int M = 2 * mp + 1;                       // number of Fourier coefficients (always odd)
060                final double[] dx = new double[N];              // dx[k] is the delta-x for polygon segment <k,k+1>
061                final double[] dy = new double[N];              // dy[k] is the delta-y for polygon segment <k,k+1>
062                final double[] lambda = new double[N];  // lambda[k] is the length of the polygon segment <k,k+1>
063                final double[] L  = new double[N + 1];  // T[k] is the cumulated path length at polygon vertex k in [0,K]
064        
065        Complex[] G = new Complex[M];
066        
067        L[0] = 0;
068        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {   // compute Dx, Dy, Dt and t tables
069            dx[i] = g[(i + 1) % N].re - g[i].re;
070            dy[i] = g[(i + 1) % N].im - g[i].im;
071            lambda[i] = sqrt(sqr(dx[i]) + sqr(dy[i]));  // TODO: use hypot()
072            if (Arithmetic.isZero(lambda[i])) {
073                        throw new Error("zero-length polygon segment!");
074                }
075            L[i+1] = L[i] + lambda[i];
076        }
077        
078        double Ln = L[N];       // Ln is the closed polygon length
079               
080        // calculate DFT coefficient G[0]:
081        double x0 = g[0].re; // V[0].getX();
082        double y0 = g[0].im; // V[0].getY();
083        double a0 = 0;
084        double c0 = 0;
085        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {   // for each polygon vertex
086                double s = (sqr(L[i+1]) - sqr(L[i])) / (2 * lambda[i]) - L[i];
087                double xi = g[i].re; // V[i].getX();
088                double yi = g[i].im; // V[i].getY();
089                a0 = a0 + s * dx[i] + (xi - x0) * lambda[i];
090                c0 = c0 + s * dy[i] + (yi - y0) * lambda[i];
091        }
092        //G[0] = new Complex(x0 + a0/Ln, y0 + c0/Ln);
093        setCoefficient(G, 0, new Complex(x0 + a0/Ln, y0 + c0/Ln));
094        
095        // calculate remaining FD pairs G[-m], G[+m] for m = 1,...,Mp
096        for (int m = 1; m <= mp; m++) { // for each FD pair
097                double w = 2 * PI * m / Ln;
098                double a = 0, c = 0;
099                double b = 0, d = 0;
100            for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {       //      for each polygon vertex
101                double w0 = w * L[i];                           
102                double w1 = w * L[(i + 1) % N];         
103                double dCos = cos(w1) - cos(w0);
104                a = a + dCos * (dx[i] / lambda[i]);
105                c = c + dCos * (dy[i] / lambda[i]);
106                double dSin = sin(w1) - sin(w0);
107                b = b + dSin * (dx[i] / lambda[i]);
108                d = d + dSin * (dy[i] / lambda[i]);
109            }
110            double s = Ln / sqr(2 * PI * m);
111            setCoefficient(G, +m, new Complex(s * (a + d), s * (c - b)));
112            setCoefficient(G, -m, new Complex(s * (a - d), s * (b + c)));
113        }
114        
115        return G;
116        }
117        
118        private static void setCoefficient(Complex[] C, int m, Complex z) {
119                C[mod(m, C.length)] = z;
120        }
121        
122//      private static void setCoefficient(Complex[] G, int m, Complex z) {
123//              int mm = Arithmetic.mod(m, G.length);
124//              G[mm] = new Complex(z);
125//      }
126
127}
